title: Outlander
description: Outlander follows the story of Claire Randall, a World War II combat nurse who is mysteriously transported back in time to 18th century Scotland, where she becomes entangled in the Jacobite risings and a passionate love story with a Highland warrior.

author.name: Diana Gabaldon
author.bio: Diana Gabaldon is a New York Times bestselling author known for her Outlander series.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
image: /imgs/Books/Rich Dad Poor Dad (Robert Kiyosaki)/Rich Dad Poor Dad.jpg
description: Rich Dad Poor Dad explores the differences between two fathers – one wealthy and one poor – and how their approaches to money and life shaped the author's financial understanding. It offers life-changing lessons on financial independence and investing.

author.name: Robert Kiyosaki
author.bio: Robert Kiyosaki is an entrepreneur and author known for his financial education books.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
image: /imgs/Books/To kill a Mockingbird (Harper Lee)/To kill a Mockingbird.jpg
description: Set in the Depression-era South, To Kill a Mockingbird follows young Scout Finch as she witnesses her father, lawyer Atticus Finch, defend a black man accused of raping a white woman, exploring themes of racial injustice, moral complexity, and coming of age.

author.name: Harper Lee
author.bio: Harper Lee was an American novelist best known for her novel To Kill a Mockingbird.

title: Becoming
description: A deeply personal memoir by Michelle Obama, chronicling her roots in Chicago, her journey through Princeton and Harvard, her professional career, and her time as First Lady of the United States.

author.name: Michelle Obama
author.bio: Michelle Obama is an American attorney and author, and the first African-American First Lady of the United States.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
image: /imgs/Books/The Catcher in the Rye (J.D. Salinger)/The Catcher in the Rye.jpg
description: The Catcher in the Rye narrates the life of Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager in New York City who is grappling with the pain of growing up and the complexities of adult society.

author.name: J.D. Salinger
author.bio: J.D. Salinger was an American writer known for his widely-read novel The Catcher in the Rye.

title: The Secret
description: The Secret reveals the law of attraction, explaining how positive thinking and visualization can transform one's life. The book argues that by focusing on positive thoughts, individuals can attract wealth, health, and happiness, offering a philosophy of personal empowerment and manifestation.

author.name: Rhonda Byrne
author.bio: Rhonda Byrne is an Australian television producer and author known for her work on The Secret.

title: The Sand Child
description: A powerful novel exploring gender identity and societal expectations in Morocco, The Sand Child tells the story of Ahmed/Fatima, a girl raised as a boy to fulfill her father's desire for a male heir. The narrative delves into complex themes of gender, identity, and cultural constraints.

author.name: Tahar Ben Jelloun
author.bio: Tahar Ben Jelloun is a Moroccan-French author known for his works addressing social issues.

title: War and Peace
image: /imgs/Books/War and Peace (Leo Tolstoy)/War and Peace (Leo Tolstoy).jpg
description: An epic novel that intertwines the lives of Russian aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Era, exploring themes of love, war, history, and the philosophical meaning of life.

author.name: Leo Tolstoy
author.bio: Leo Tolstoy was a Russian writer regarded as one of the greatest authors of all time.

title: The Alchemist
description: The Alchemist is an inspiring tale of Santiago, a shepherd boy who embarks on a journey to find a treasure hidden in the Egyptian pyramids, learning valuable life lessons about following one's dreams and listening to one's heart.

author.name: Paulo Coelho
author.bio: Paulo Coelho is a Brazilian author known for his novel The Alchemist and other inspirational works.

title: The Great Gatsby
image: /imgs/Worl Books/The Great Gatsby (F. Scott Fitzgerald)/The Great Gatsby.jpg
description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, The Great Gatsby explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream through the eyes of Nick Carraway, a young man who is drawn into the world of his mysterious neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

author.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
author.bio: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer, widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century.

title: The Hobbit
description: The Hobbit is a high fantasy adventure that follows Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the Lonely Mountain and its treasure from the dragon Smaug. Along the way, he encounters trolls, elves, goblins, and an enchanted ring.

author.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
author.bio: J.R.R. Tolkien was an English writer, professor, and philologist, best known for his works The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.

title: Omniscient Reader's Viewpoint
description: Omniscient Reader's Viewpoint follows the story of Kim Dokja, an ordinary office worker who finds himself in a world transformed by a novel he has been reading. As the only one aware of the plot, he must navigate the challenges of this new world using his knowledge to survive.

author.name: Sing Shong
author.bio: Sing Shong is a South Korean author known for the popular web novel 'Omniscient Reader's Viewpoint'.
